thread.title: Texas Rangers: MLB Network: Rangers catcher Jonathan Lucroy is baseball's No. 2 behind the plate | SportsDay
thread.title_full: Texas Rangers: MLB Network: Rangers catcher Jonathan Lucroy is baseball's No. 2 behind the plate | SportsDay

author: Barry Horn
title: Texas Rangers: MLB Network: Rangers catcher Jonathan Lucroy is baseball's No. 2 behind the plate | SportsDay
text:
Comment on This Story Louis DeLuca/Staff Photographer Texas Rangers catcher Jonathan Lucroy (25) blocks the throw as it comes in from the outfield as the Angels score a third-inning run during the Los Angeles Angels vs. the Texas Rangers major league baseball game at Globe Life Park in Arlington on Wednesday, September 21, 2016. (Louis DeLuca/The Dallas Morning News) By Barry Horn , Staff Writer Contact Barry Horn on Twitter: @bhorn55 
MLB Network ranked the Rangers' Jonathan Lucroy as the second best catcher in the game going into the 2017 season. 
Only the San Francisco Giants' Buster Posey ranked higher when the network listed its top 10 at the position on Sunday. 
According to MLB network, its ranking are based on "player performance over several seasons with an emphasis on 2016 and a number of offensive and defensive metrics, both advanced and traditional, and projected performance for the upcoming season." 
Here's MLB's lineup: 
1. Buster Posey, San Francisco Giants 
2. Jonathan Lucroy, Rangers 
3. Yasmani Grandal, Los Angeles Dodgers 
4. Wilson Ramos, Tampa Bay Rays 
5. Russell Martin, Toronto Blue Jays 
6. Yadier Molina, St. Louis Cardinals 
7. Francisco Cervelli, Pittsburgh Pirates 
8. J.T. Realmuto, Miami Marlins 
9. Salvador Perez, Kansas City Royals 
10. Welington Castillo, Baltimore Orioles
